title: Is a master's degree a post secondary degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: A Master’s degree is a postgraduate degree and that means that it is the next and higher level of studies, after the completion of undergraduate studies which awards a Bachelor degree. Under the European Qualifications Framework (EQF), Bachelor degrees are at Level 6, Master degrees are at Level 7 and Doctorates (phD) are at the higher Level, 8. Postsecondary studies are after the completion of secondary or Level 3 studies, the High School diploma or any GCSE, and it is at Level 4 and it is usually specialized in a vocational or technical context. International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED) is the corresponding and similar international level system if you would like to compare and investigate further.
“ Secondary” refers to high school. All college degrees are post secondary.
